text: The 1996-97 Austrian football championship was played in the 1. Bundesliga, Austria's top division. The second division was called the Bundesliga – 2. Division. The third tier consisted of the Regionalliga Ost (Vienna, Lower Austria, Burgenland) and West (Salzburg, Tyrol, Vorarlberg). The third group was the Regionalliga Mitte (Carinthia, Upper Austria,Styria). SC Austria Lustenau was promoted to the Bundesliga. Admira Wacker stayed in the Bundesliga after relegation versus SK Vorwärts Steyr. Ten clubs competed against each other in a total of 36 rounds. Each team played twice at home and away against every other team. SV Austria Salzburg became Austrian champions for the second time in club history. Grazer AK played most of its home games in Kapfenberg while the club's stadium in Graz was being renovated. LASK Linz and FC Linz merged towards the end of the season. Ronald Brunmayr (FK Austria Wien), Wolfgang Knaller (FK Austria Wien/SCN Admira/Wacker), Christian Prosenik (SK Rapid Wien/SV Austria Salzburg) and Gerald Strafner (GAK) played all league matches for their teams. ==Final table== Pl.
